Subject: NEAT4J in OSX, noob can't run xor example

Hello list,

I'm trying to run the xor train and test examples in the NEAT4J  
package. Firstly I assume for OSX (Unix-based) those semi-colons  
between paths in the .bat files should be colons (java spits out it's  
usage message otherwise). Having changed this, for some reason  
NEATGATrainingManager is not managing to read xor_neat.ga, causing  
this output...

************************************************************************ 
*****
tansur:~/Desktop/neat4j_1_0 hf208$ ./xor_train.bat xor_neat.ga
Creating Default Config
Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NumberFormatException: null
         at java.lang.Integer.parseInt(Integer.java:415)
         at java.lang.Integer.parseInt(Integer.java:497)
         at  
org.neat4j.neat.applications.train.NEATGATrainingManager.createDescripto 
r(NEATGATrainingManager.java:115)
         at  
org.neat4j.neat.applications.train.NEATGATrainingManager.initialise 
(NEATGATrainingManager.java:50)
         at  
org.neat4j.neat.applications.train.NEATGATrainingManager.main 
(NEATGATrainingManager.java:379)
************************************************************************ 
*****

That's odd because xor_neat.ga is in the current directory and should  
be found by java.io. Am I doing something blatantly wrong here?

To get around this I made an Xcode project (Apple's default IDE) and  
threw all of the files into it. This solved the above problem (I  
think), but gives me this...

************************************************************************ 
*****
log4j:WARN No appenders could be found for logger  
(org.neat4j.neat.core.control.NEATNetManager).
log4j:WARN Please initialize the log4j system properly.

java has exited with status 0.
************************************************************************ 
*****

I don't know if this is a fatal error or not and I am not at all  
familiar with log4j. The file xor_neat_ga.ser appeared in the xor  
folder. However, since the next stage should be to call "xor_test.bat  
xor_neat_ga.app", and I am now working in an Xcode project, it all  
gets a bit confusing (what is xor_neat_ga.app?). This makes me think  
I'd better go back and fix the command-line approach first.

Other info:
java version "1.5.0_06"
Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build 1.5.0_06-112)
Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM (build 1.5.0_06-64, mixed mode, sharing)
System software: Mac OSX 10.4.8.

Ollie Bown
